P.title: Will the integration of AI into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems has caused the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly. Significant fluctuation is defined as a change of more than 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swiss Franc, and Australian Dollar) within a single calendar year, as reported by the Federal Reserve. The fluctuation must be directly attributed to the integration of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

cons_P.title: Will the integration of AI into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate by more than 10% against a basket of major currencies in a single calendar year by 2030?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems has caused the value of the US dollar to fluctuate by more than 10% in a single calendar year. The fluctuation must be directly attributed to the integration of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

verification_result.reasoning: Q is a logical consequence of P because the definition of significant fluctuation in P is a change of more than 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies within a single calendar year. Q uses the same threshold of more than 10% fluctuation within a single calendar year. Therefore, if P is true, Q must also be true. The criteria for attribution and confirmation are also identical in both propositions. Hence, Q is a logical consequence of P.

P.title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to new economic industries by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has led to the establishment of new economic industries. These industries must be directly related to the utilization, research, or technology development of dark matter and must represent a new sector of the economy not previously existing. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by at least one of the following: 
- Official announcement from a major economic or scientific institution. 
- Coverage in at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 
- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific or economic journal. 
For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic industries" refers to sectors or fields of economic activity that are newly created and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic landscape.

cons_P.title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to new economic industries by 2030 as confirmed by at least one major economic or scientific institution?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has led to the establishment of new economic industries. These industries must be directly related to the utilization, research, or technology development of dark matter and must represent a new sector of the economy not previously existing. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by at least one major economic or scientific institution. For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the hypothetical form of matter thought to account for approximately 85% of the matter in the universe and about a quarter of its total energy density. The term "new economic industries" refers to sectors or fields of economic activity that are newly created and have not been previously classified as part of the existing economic landscape.

verification_result.reasoning: Q is a logical consequence of P because P provides three criteria for confirmation (official announcement from a major economic or scientific institution, coverage in at least three reputable news sources, or publication in a peer-reviewed journal), and Q specifies only one of these criteria (confirmation by a major economic or scientific institution). If P is true, then Q must also be true because meeting any one of the criteria in P, including the one specified in Q, would satisfy Q. Therefore, Q is a subset of P and is a logical consequence of P.

P.title: Will a major golf tournament commit to achieving carbon neutrality by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any of the four major golf tournaments (The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or PGA Championship) officially commits to achieving carbon neutrality. The commitment must include a detailed plan for achieving carbon neutrality in operations, including but not limited to energy use, transportation, and waste management. The plan must be publicly available and endorsed by the tournament's organizing body. Verification will be based on official announcements or documentation from the tournament's organizing body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN) are sufficient. Temporary or partial commitments, such as for a single edition of the tournament, do not count towards this question's resolution.

cons_P.title: Will a major golf tournament commit to achieving carbon neutrality in operations by 2025?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any of the four major golf tournaments (The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or PGA Championship) officially commits to achieving carbon neutrality in operations. The commitment must include a detailed plan for achieving carbon neutrality in operations, including but not limited to energy use, transportation, and waste management. The plan must be publicly available and endorsed by the tournament's organizing body. Verification will be based on official announcements or documentation from the tournament's organizing body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN) are sufficient. Temporary or partial commitments, such as for a single edition of the tournament, do not count towards this question's resolution.

verification_result.reasoning: Q is a logical consequence of P because the criteria for achieving carbon neutrality in operations (Q) are a subset of the criteria for achieving overall carbon neutrality (P). If a major golf tournament commits to achieving carbon neutrality (P), it must include a detailed plan for achieving carbon neutrality in operations, which is the focus of Q. Therefore, Q will always be true if P is true.

P.title: Will a major aerospace company announce a breakthrough in environmentally sustainable aviation technology by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major aerospace company (defined as a company with a significant share in the global aerospace market, such as Boeing, Airbus, Lockheed Martin, or equivalent) announces a breakthrough in environmentally sustainable aviation technology. The breakthrough must represent a significant advancement in reducing the environmental impact of aviation, such as a new propulsion system, fuel efficiency improvement, or emissions reduction technology. The announcement must be confirmed through an official press release by the company or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple announcements, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Temporary or experimental technologies not intended for commercial use do not count towards this question's resolution.

cons_P.title: Will a major aerospace company announce a breakthrough in reducing the environmental impact of aviation by 2030?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major aerospace company (defined as a company with a significant share in the global aerospace market, such as Boeing, Airbus, Lockheed Martin, or equivalent) announces a breakthrough in reducing the environmental impact of aviation. The breakthrough must represent a significant advancement in reducing the environmental impact of aviation, such as a new propulsion system, fuel efficiency improvement, or emissions reduction technology. The announcement must be confirmed through an official press release by the company or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple announcements, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Temporary or experimental technologies not intended for commercial use do not count towards this question's resolution.

Temporary or experimental technologies not intended for commercial use do not count towards this question's resolution.

verification_result.reasoning: Q is a logical consequence of P because the criteria for Q are a subset of the criteria for P. Both propositions require a major aerospace company to announce a breakthrough in reducing the environmental impact of aviation by 2030. However, P specifies that the breakthrough must be in environmentally sustainable aviation technology, which inherently includes reducing the environmental impact. Therefore, if P is true, Q must also be true. The definitions and criteria in Q are not more vague but are actually a subset of those in P.

P.title: Will Japan introduce a new constitution amendment related to digital privacy by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Japan has officially introduced a new amendment to its constitution that specifically addresses digital privacy. The amendment must explicitly mention digital privacy as its focus and aim to enhance the protection of citizens' digital data from unauthorized access, use, or surveillance. The introduction of such an amendment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The amendment must be passed and incorporated into the Japanese Constitution, not merely proposed or under consideration. In the event of ambiguity regarding the amendment's focus on digital privacy, the question will resolve as No.

cons_P.title: Will Japan introduce any new constitutional amendment by 2025?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Japan has officially introduced any new amendment to its constitution. The introduction of such an amendment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The amendment must be passed and incorporated into the Japanese Constitution, not merely proposed or under consideration.

In the event of ambiguity regarding the amendment's focus on digital privacy, the question will resolve as No.

verification_result.reasoning: If Japan introduces a new constitutional amendment specifically related to digital privacy by 2025 (P), then it is necessarily true that Japan has introduced a new constitutional amendment by 2025 (Q). This is because an amendment related to digital privacy is a subset of any new constitutional amendment. Therefore, Q is a logical consequence of P.
